title: With how strong bot lane and jungle are, we should look at solo kill gold again.
body: One thing I never really understood about league is why solo kills were worth less gold. It doesn't make sense to punish punish teams for achieving the same gold while committing less resources. In previous seasons, this was balanced out by solo laners having a higher proportion of gold and influence. However, now that every game is being decided by the bot lane and jungle, adjusting solo kill gold to be worth more would go a long way in putting power back into solo lane players.

Whatever is done, just don't take this topic's suggestion. The argument it makes is actually opposite the important logic: why should a teammate incur a penalty because I helped him secure a kill? Making solo kills give more gold to the killer than assisted kills presents a really shitty situation for anyone who wants to assist (do I want more gold on this guy or do I want more gold teamwide?). Also, solo kills are REALLY unlikely at higher levels of play, so adjusting solo kill gold isn't likely to fix the problems there.

If you look at anything in the neighborhood, (and I don't think you should) it should be increasing kill gold and reducing assist gold so that it ends up around the same total on an assisted kill, but a greater proportion goes to the person who gets the kill. This also, unfortunately, means increasing kill gold at baseline, which seems like a pretty sacred-do-not-touch thing. (Affects too much.)

It'd make more sense, imo, to look to address the issues with support gold and ADC itemization before this was looked into (admittedly, this doesn't touch the jungle, but it's a start, and- it'll also indirectly affect jungle powerlevel). -Especially- after the AP item changes, there's less of a meaningful difference in item spike timings between bot and other lanes, and ever since supports have been "freed" from sightstone, they've been "freed" to get that much more power in gold put elsewhere. (Maybe the changes to GLP will help with mid spikes, but I'm not holding my breath; tear is prevalent, and very slow to give midlaners power besides the ability to waveclear more before basing.)

Adjusting globally-affected gold income to lower the power of bot/jg is trying to fix an issue with a lever that affects way more than it. It makes sense to nerf gp10 if support has too much gold. It makes sense to maybe play with camp values, respawns, things like that if JG has too much gold. But it doesn't really make sense to play with things like kill gold or tower gold to fix those, since those affect so many things. (The only real exception here might be first tower bonus, since that feels particularly likely to occur around the ADC/support. I suppose outer turret local gold is also likely to get obtained -first- by the ADC, too, so shifting some or all of that local gold back into global gold might help, too. That's assuming it really is disproportionately likely that ADC/support get local tower gold before anyone else, though. I'd guess it is, but I don't know for certain.)

i think the bigger issue is killstreak shutdown and assist streaks.
Back in the daym killstrak shutdowns would grant more money to those that actually are involved but non global and less overall, helping champs to come back in a loosing lane if their opponent oversteps and dies despide beeing 3/0 or something. It also made helping a loosing lane more attractive as jungler.
Even more important, assists would also countribute to the shutdown value, so a 0/0/6 would also give shutdown, which is was important for turning around games as a loosing team.
Since 5.22, assists no longer give any shutdown and shotdown gold is golbaly distributed.
This means if i crush toplane and get shut down by their jungler, their bot profits from me doing well. They get gold because i got kills and then died. If i didn't get a couple of solo kills, they would not profit from me dieing top. Given how much more botlane scales of gold and how much more impact they have later on, this means that getting a solojill can be strategically the wrong call, and that feels horrible.
It also means that i will continue to somp the lane as my direct opponent doesn't get as much profit as befor and most likely stays behind, which makes the lane in it's own more snowbally.
The lack of assist shutdown means if you spread out the kills over your team and just gang up on opponents, they gain less shutdown than if a single player goes rampage, especially active junglers can get alot impact and if they mostly get assists, they don't have to care about giveing away shutdown gold at all.

I think what needs to be done regarding solo kills vs assisted kills is that assists should count as 0.5kills towards the shutdown bounty, just how they are rewarded 0.5 the kill bounty. 
Then there are two options to handle the shutdown bounty: either bring it back to s imple increase of the kill bounty that is spreat localy amongst killer and assists rather than global, or keep it global but also reward kill/assist streaks with global gold for your team, so if i get 3 kills as a sololaner, the rest of my team allso gets a small gold advantage and the opponents can shut me down to balance it out.
It would also be interesting to get a 'revenge' mechanic that gives a small extra reward for anyone that was killed by me that is invloved in takeing me down, stacking up, so shutdowns can help bringing a loosing lane back on pair some more.

I really think gold per kill should worth almost the same regardless of how many people were involved and the total should be equally shared by everyone. Example:

Let's say a kill is worth 600g 

If you kill a person solo you earn 600g. 

1 P = 600g
2 P = 300g each
3 P = 200g each
4 P = 150g each
5 p = 120g each

600 for 1 kill? Noooo.

Should be 325 and reduced by 25 for each assister, and assisters should get 25 gold.

I used the number as a figurative example so the calculations ended up being round-up to be easy to understand the math. The value of a kill is moot here, the point is that I believe the gold should be shared equally with everyone participating on it. 

With that change solo kills will be worth more and teams that 4 man bot wouldn't end up with more gold per kill than a top laner killing his enemy by himself top. 

You can put any value in that example and the point still the same. 

Let's say a kill is worth 300g

If you kill a person solo you earn 300g.

1 P = 300g
2 P = 150g each
3 P = 100g each
4 P = 75g each
5 p = 60g each

Taking gold away from the killer seems like a bad idea. Maybe give out less assist gold the more assists there are, but it shouldn't be a flat number. Having more people involved should equal more gold overall, even if each individual person gets less. Something like

Kill equals 300 (300 total gold for entire team) 
1 assist equals 50 (350 gold for entire team) 
2 assists equal 40 each (380 gold for entire team) 
3 assists equal 30 each ( 390 gold for entire team) 
4 assists equal 25 each (400 gold for entire team) 

The numbers are just examples, but the idea is what's important.
